push.description: Pushes a value onto the stack.

dup.description: Duplicate the top value of the stack and push it onto the stack.

swap.description: Swap the value at the top of the stack with the one below it.

block.description: Creates a new block.The term block here has the same meaning as function.

drop.description: Removes the top value from the stack.

over.description: Add a duplicate of the above value to the second of the stack.

rot.description: Rotate the top three values on the stack. e.x. [a, b, c] -> [c, a, b].

typeof.description: Returns the type of the top value on the stack.

input.description: Reads a line of text from the user.

puts.description: Prints the top value on the stack. However, no line breaks will be used.

print.description: Prints the top value on the stack. A line break will be used.

append.description: Adds a value to the end of the list.
